00042 /**************************************************************************/
00064 /* this should be approx 2 Bo*oMips to start (note initial shift), and will
00065  *    still work even if initially too large, it will just take slightly longer */
00066 volatile unsigned long loops_per_jiffy = (1<<12);
00067 
00068 /* This is the number of bits of precision for the loops_per_jiffy.  Each
00069  *    bit takes on average 1.5/HZ seconds.  This (like the original) is a little
00070  *       better than 1% */
00071 #define LPS_PREC 8
00072 
00073 static void calibrate_delay(void);
00074 __STATIC_INLINE uint32_t clock(void);
00075 static void _delay( uint32_t delay);
00076 
00079 /***************************************************************************/
00083 void UDELAY_Calibrate(void)
00084 {
00085   CMU_Select_TypeDef lfaClkSel;
00086   CMU_ClkDiv_TypeDef rtcClkDiv;
00087   bool rtcRestore       = false;
00088   bool leClkTurnoff     = false;
00089   bool rtcClkTurnoff    = false;
00090   bool lfaClkSrcRestore = false;
00091   bool lfaClkTurnoff    = false;
00092   RTC_Init_TypeDef init = RTC_INIT_DEFAULT;
00093   uint32_t rtcCtrl=0, rtcComp0=0, rtcComp1=0, rtcIen=0;
00094 
00095   /* Ensure LE modules are accessible */
00096   if ( !( CMU->HFCORECLKEN0 & CMU_HFCORECLKEN0_LE) )
00097   {
00098     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_CORELE, true);
00099     leClkTurnoff = true;
00100   }
00101 
00102   lfaClkSel = CMU_ClockSelectGet(cmuClock_LFA);
00103 
00104   #if defined( UDELAY_LFXO )
00105     if ( !(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFXOENS) )
00106     {
00107       lfaClkTurnoff = true;
00108       CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_LFXO, true, true);
00109     }
00110 
00111     if ( lfaClkSel != cmuSelect_LFXO )
00112     {
00113       lfaClkSrcRestore = true;
00114       CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFA, cmuSelect_LFXO);
00115     }
00116 
00117   #else
00118     if ( lfaClkSel != cmuSelect_LFRCO )
00119     {
00120       lfaClkSrcRestore = true;
00121     }
00122     if ( !(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFRCOENS) )
00123     {
00124       lfaClkTurnoff = true;
00125     }
00126     /* Enable LFACLK in CMU (will also enable oscillator if not enabled) */
00127     CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFA, cmuSelect_LFRCO);
00128   #endif
00129 
00130   /* Set up a reasonable prescaler. */
00131   rtcClkDiv = CMU_ClockDivGet(cmuClock_RTC);
00132   CMU_ClockDivSet(cmuClock_RTC, cmuClkDiv_256);
00133 
00134   if ( !(CMU->LFACLKEN0 & CMU_LFACLKEN0_RTC) )
00135   {
00136     /* Enable clock to RTC module */
00137     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_RTC, true);
00138     rtcClkTurnoff = true;
00139   }
00140 
00141   INT_Disable();
00142 
00143   if ( RTC->CTRL & RTC_CTRL_EN )
00144   {
00145     /* Stash away current RTC settings. */
00146     rtcCtrl   = RTC->CTRL;
00147     rtcComp0  = RTC->COMP0;
00148     rtcComp1  = RTC->COMP1;
00149     rtcIen    = RTC->IEN;
00150 
00151     RTC->CTRL = _RTC_CTRL_RESETVALUE;
00152     RTC->IEN  = 0;
00153     RTC->IFC  = _RTC_IEN_MASK;
00154 
00155     NVIC_ClearPendingIRQ( RTC_IRQn );
00156 
00157     rtcRestore = true;
00158   }
00159 
00160   init.comp0Top = false;  /* Count to max before wrapping */
00161   RTC_Init(&init);        /* Start RTC counter. */
00162 
00163   calibrate_delay();      /* Calibrate the micro second delay loop. */
00164 
00165   INT_Enable();
00166 
00167   /* Restore all RTC related settings to how they were previously set. */
00168   if ( rtcRestore )
00169   {
00170     CMU_ClockDivSet(cmuClock_RTC, rtcClkDiv);
00171 
00172     RTC_FreezeEnable(true);
00173     #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00174       RTC_Sync(RTC_SYNCBUSY_COMP0 | RTC_SYNCBUSY_COMP1 | RTC_SYNCBUSY_CTRL);
00175     #endif
00176     RTC->COMP0 = rtcComp0;
00177     RTC->COMP1 = rtcComp1;
00178     RTC->CTRL  = rtcCtrl;
00179     RTC->IEN   = rtcIen;
00180     RTC_FreezeEnable(false);
00181   }
00182   else
00183   {
00184     RTC_Enable(false);
00185   }
00186 
00187   if ( rtcClkTurnoff )
00188   {
00189     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_RTC, false);
00190   }
00191 
00192   if ( lfaClkSrcRestore )
00193   {
00194     CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFA, lfaClkSel);
00195   }
00196 
00197   if ( lfaClkTurnoff )
00198   {
00199     #if defined( UDELAY_LFXO )
00200       CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_LFXO, false, false);
00201     #else
00202       CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_LFRCO, false, false);
00203     #endif
00204   }
00205 
00206   if ( leClkTurnoff )
00207   {
00208     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_CORELE, false);
00209   }
00210 }

00212 #if defined(__GNUC__) /* GCC */
00213 /***************************************************************************/
00220 void UDELAY_Delay( uint32_t usecs )
00221 {
00222   __ASM volatile (
00223 #if defined(_EFM32_ZERO_FAMILY)
00224 "        .syntax unified           \n"
00225 "        .arch armv6-m             \n"
00226 #endif
00227 "        movs    r2, #0x88         \n"
00228 "        lsls    r2, r2, #8        \n"
00229 "        adds    r2, #0x00         \n"
00230 "        muls    %0, r2            \n"
00231 "                                  \n"
00232 "        ldr     r2, [%1]          \n"
00233 "        movs    r0, %0, lsr #11   \n"
00234 "        movs    r2, r2, lsr #11   \n"
00235 "                                  \n"
00236 "        muls    r0, r2            \n"
00237 "        movs    r0, r0, lsr #6    \n"
00238 "                                  \n"
00239 "        beq.n   2f                \n"
00240 "                                  \n"
00241 "1:      subs    r0, #1            \n"
00242 "        bhi     1b                \n"
00243 #if defined(_EFM32_ZERO_FAMILY)
00244 "2:                                \n"
00245 "        .syntax divided           \n" : : "r" (usecs), "r" (&loops_per_jiffy) );
00246 #else
00247 "2:                                \n" : : "r" (usecs), "r" (&loops_per_jiffy) );
00248 #endif
00249 }
00250 #endif /* defined(__GNUC__) */
00251 
00254 static void calibrate_delay(void)
00255 {
00256   /* From linux 2.4 source. */
00257   unsigned long loopbit;
00258   unsigned long ticks;
00259   int lps_precision = LPS_PREC;
00260 
00261   loops_per_jiffy = (1<<12);
00262 
00263   while (loops_per_jiffy <<= 1) {
00264     /* wait for "start of" clock tick */
00265     ticks = clock();
00266     while (ticks == clock())
00267       /* nothing */;
00268     /* Go .. */
00269     ticks = clock();
00270     _delay(loops_per_jiffy);
00271     ticks = clock() - ticks;
00272     if (ticks)
00273       break;
00274   }
00275 
00276   /* Do a binary approximation to get loops_per_jiffy set to equal one clock
00277      (up to lps_precision bits) */
00278 
00279   loops_per_jiffy >>= 1;
00280   loopbit = loops_per_jiffy;
00281   while ( lps_precision-- && (loopbit >>= 1) ) {
00282     loops_per_jiffy |= loopbit;
00283     ticks = clock();
00284     while (ticks == clock());
00285     ticks = clock();
00286     _delay(loops_per_jiffy);
00287     if (clock() != ticks)   /* longer than 1 tick */
00288       loops_per_jiffy &= ~loopbit;
00289   }
00290 }
00291 
00292 __STATIC_INLINE uint32_t clock(void)
00293 {
00294   return RTC_CounterGet();
00295 }
00296 
00297 #if defined(__ICCARM__) /* IAR */
00298 static void _delay( uint32_t delay)
00299 {
00300   __ASM volatile (
00301 "_delay_1:                         \n"
00302 "        subs    r0, #1            \n"
00303 "        bhi.n   _delay_1          \n" );
00304 }
00305 
00306 void UDELAY_Delay( uint32_t usecs )
00307 {
00308   __ASM volatile (
00309 "        movs    r2, #0x88         \n"
00310 "        lsls    r2, r2, #8        \n"
00311 "        adds    r2, #0x00         \n"
00312 "        muls    r0, r2            \n"
00313 "                                  \n"
00314 "        ldr     r2, [%0]          \n"
00315 "        movs    r0, r0, lsr #11   \n"
00316 "        movs    r2, r2, lsr #11   \n"
00317 "                                  \n"
00318 "        muls    r0, r2            \n"
00319 "        movs    r0, r0, lsr #6    \n"
00320 "                                  \n"
00321 "        bne.n   udelay_1          \n"
00322 "        bx      lr                \n"
00323 "                                  \n"
00324 "udelay_1:                         \n"
00325 "        subs    r0, #1            \n"
00326 "        bhi.n   udelay_1          \n" : : "r" (&loops_per_jiffy) );
00327 }
00328 #endif /* defined(__ICCARM__) */
00329 
00330 #if defined(__GNUC__) /* GCC */
00331 static void _delay( uint32_t delay )
00332 {
00333   __ASM volatile (
00334 #if defined(_EFM32_ZERO_FAMILY)
00335 "        .syntax unified           \n"
00336 "        .arch armv6-m             \n"
00337 #endif
00338 "1:      subs    %0, #1            \n"
00339 #if defined(_EFM32_ZERO_FAMILY)
00340 "        bhi.n   1b                \n"
00341 "        .syntax divided           \n" : : "r" (delay) );
00342 #else
00343 "        bhi.n   1b                \n" : : "r" (delay) );
00344 #endif
00345 }
00346 #endif /* defined(__GNUC__) */
00347 
00348 #if defined(__CC_ARM) /* Keil */
00349 static __ASM void _delay( uint32_t delay)
00350 {
00351 _delay_1
00352         subs    r0, #1
00353         bhi     _delay_1
00354         bx      lr
00355 }
00356 
00357 __ASM void UDELAY_Delay( uint32_t usecs __attribute__ ((unused)) )
00358 {
00359         IMPORT  loops_per_jiffy
00360 
00361         movs    r2, #0x88
00362         lsls    r2, r2, #8
00363         adds    r2, #0x00
00364         muls    r0, r2, r0
00365 
00366         ldr     r2, =loops_per_jiffy
00367         ldr     r2, [r2]
00368         movs    r0, r0, lsr #11
00369         movs    r2, r2, lsr #11
00370 
00371         muls    r0, r2, r0
00372         movs    r0, r0, lsr #6
00373 
00374         bne     udelay_1
00375         bx      lr
00376 
00377 udelay_1
00378         subs    r0, #1
00379         bhi     udelay_1
00380         bx      lr
00381 }
00382 #endif /* defined(__CC_ARM) */
